content.user_title: Learn plugin structure for Claude Code
content.value_statement: You need clear guidance to organize a Claude Code plugin correctly. This skill explains the required layout, manifest fields, and auto discovery rules.
actual_capabilities: Explain the required plugin directory layout and component locations
Describe required and recommended fields in .claude-plugin/plugin.json
Detail auto discovery rules for commands, agents, skills, hooks, and MCP servers
Provide naming conventions for components and supporting files
limitations: Does not generate or edit plugin files automatically
Does not validate a real plugin.json file against runtime rules
Does not install or enable plugins in Claude Code
Does not run or test hooks or MCP servers

use_cases.title: Plan a new plugin layout
use_cases.description: Get a clear directory map and manifest checklist before you start building.

use_cases.title: Standardize plugin structure
use_cases.description: Align team components with naming rules and auto discovery expectations.

use_cases.title: Prepare for submission
use_cases.description: Verify required metadata and structure for a publishable plugin.

prompt_templates.title: Quick structure check
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a draft plugin layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this planned folder layout and tell me what is missing for a valid Claude Code plugin.

prompt_templates.title: Manifest basics
prompt_templates.prompt: List the required and recommended fields for .claude-plugin/plugin.json and explain the naming rules.

prompt_templates.title: Component discovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how auto discovery works and how custom paths in plugin.json supplement defaults.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced organization
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose an organized structure for commands, agents, skills, hooks, and scripts for a large plugin with many components.

output_examples.input: Explain the required plugin structure and the key manifest rules.
output: Place plugin.json in .claude-plugin at the plugin root
Keep commands, agents, skills, and hooks at the root level
Use kebab case names and include a name field in plugin.json

best_practices: Keep plugin.json minimal unless custom paths are needed
Group related components and document the layout
anti_patterns: Using absolute paths or missing ./ in plugin.json

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code plugins only?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets the Claude Code plugin system and its auto discovery rules.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not generate files or validate a real plugin.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing repos?
faq.answer: It can explain how to map your repo into the required structure, but it will not edit files.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It only reads the provided instructions and does not store user data.

faq.question: What should I do if a component does not load?
faq.answer: Check file locations, YAML frontmatter, and path rules in plugin.json.

faq.question: How does this compare to a template generator?
faq.answer: This skill explains rules and patterns, while a generator creates files automatically.
